#Apple Patches Vision Pro Vulnerability Used in Possibly ‘First Ever Spatial Computing Hack’ - CVE-2024-27812 https://www.securityweek.com/apple-patches-vision-pro-vulnerability-used-in-first-ever-spatial-computing-hack/ @SecurityWeek #cybersecurity #Infosec

##

CVE-2024-30078
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-11T18:30:56

13 posts

Windows Wi-Fi Driver Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

3 repos

https://github.com/lvyitian/CVE-2024-30078-

https://github.com/kvx07/CVE_2024_30078_A_POC

https://github.com/52by/CVE-2024-30078

lhc_fl@stelpolva.moe at 2024-06-17T09:07:44.443Z ##

重要/漏洞：Windows系统曝出高危漏洞，攻击者可通过Wi-Fi远程入侵设备。

漏洞编号：CVE-2024-30078
重要等级：重要
影响范围：所有支持Wi-Fi的Winodws系统 [包含Server Core installation]
[Windows 10/Windows Server 2019/Windows Server 2022/Windows 11/Windows Server 2016/Windows Server 2008/Windows Server 2012/]

漏洞概述：该漏洞存在于 Windows 的 Wi-Fi 驱动程序中，属于远程代码执行漏洞。攻击者只需在物理上接近受害者设备，即可通过 Wi-Fi 接管设备，无需与目标计算机建立物理连接。微软已确认，除了物理接近要求外，攻击者不需要任何特殊访问权限或其他特殊条件即可成功利用该漏洞。

风险描述：
1. 攻击者无需以用户身份进行身份验证。
2. 不需要访问受害者计算机上的任何设置或文件。
3. 受害者设备用户不需要进行任何交互操作，无需点击链接、加载图像或执行文件。

影响组件：Windows WiFi 驱动程序

处置建议：强烈建议用户立即更新系统至最新版本。微软已发布相关补丁以修复此漏洞。

补充：由于此漏洞的性质，在设备密集的环境中风险尤为显著，例如酒店、贸易展览会等场所，在这些地方，攻击者可在不引起警觉的情况下对大量用户发动攻击。

相关资料：微软 (https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-30078)/NIST (https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-30078)

##
joshbuker at 2024-06-16T17:58:49.606Z ##

Surprised I haven't heard more people talking about CVE-2024-30078. WiFi RCE is kinda a big deal.

#cve, #CVE_2024_30078

##
bedast@squirrelmob.com at 2024-06-15T14:52:21.000Z ##

Microsoft got Recall very wrong. And it’s good that they’re putting it on hold to rethink and rework it.

But I don’t think they learned how wrong “needs physical access” is these days.

Never mind the various phishing scams out there that has vulnerable users granting remote access to scammers. CVE-2024-30078 shows us that gaining control is still possible today without any user involvement.

This CVE is a vulnerability in Windows 11 Wifi, where an attacker can gain access to the computer and execute whatever they want without a login of any kind, and without the user doing anything. A threat actor could retrieve whatever data they wanted, probably with a decent amount of throughput with modern Wifi.

Now, Microsoft has already released an update to patch this (UPDATE NOW IF YOU RUN WINDOWS) so you can stop this, specific attack. But what about future vectors? What about people who don’t patch? What about people that wait for the next scheduled update?

And, again, Apple has their own version of Recall called Apple Intelligence, and the security community needs to start poking holes into that as well. Apple isn’t immune to this either. Apple seems to be putting more thought into privacy and security, but it’s yet to be proven.

#Microsoft #Copilot #Recall #Apple #Intelligence #AppleIntelligence #Privacy #Security

##
wolfeidau@awscommunity.social at 2024-06-15T11:38:09.000Z ##

Looks nasty, windows wifi vulnerability #security #windows

> CVE-2024-30078 Can Be Exploited Without Any User Interaction

https://www.forbes.com/sites/daveywinder/2024/06/14/new-wi-fi-takeover-attack-all-windows-users-warned-to-update-now/

##
LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-06-15T04:49:32.000Z ##

Critical bug in Windows systems. It is possible to take control of the system via Wi-Fi. The user does not have to do anything. All he needs is for someone within range of his wifi to want to hack him. The attack is simple, repeatable, reliable. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-30078

##
moira@mastodon.murkworks.net at 2024-06-15T01:11:07.000Z ##

I haven't seen this mentioned here but if you haven't updated Windows this week DO THAT NOW

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-30078

#windows #security #update

So #Microsoft, what's up with your unconditional commitment to #security?

Last patchday we had two CVE that were only considered important but actually resulted in #RCE without user interaction? I'm kind of irritated.

CVE-2024-30103

##
tmcyber at 2024-06-17T16:58:48.050Z ##

🆘 Exploit para Windows WiFi RCE (CVE-2024-30078)

Price 5000$

Escrow Anastasia

El exploit para Windows WiFi RCE (CVE-2024-30078) permite la ejecución remota de código a través de WiFi, aprovechando puntos de acceso comprometidos o redes WiFi guardadas.

Segun informan, el exploit funciona infectando a una víctima a través de malware basado en enrutador o simplemente haciendo que el dispositivo de la víctima esté dentro del alcance de una red WiFi a la que se haya conectado previamente.

👁️

##
lhc_fl@stelpolva.moe at 2024-06-17T09:07:44.443Z ##

重要/漏洞：Windows系统曝出高危漏洞，攻击者可通过Wi-Fi远程入侵设备。

漏洞编号：CVE-2024-30078
重要等级：重要
影响范围：所有支持Wi-Fi的Winodws系统 [包含Server Core installation]
[Windows 10/Windows Server 2019/Windows Server 2022/Windows 11/Windows Server 2016/Windows Server 2008/Windows Server 2012/]

漏洞概述：该漏洞存在于 Windows 的 Wi-Fi 驱动程序中，属于远程代码执行漏洞。攻击者只需在物理上接近受害者设备，即可通过 Wi-Fi 接管设备，无需与目标计算机建立物理连接。微软已确认，除了物理接近要求外，攻击者不需要任何特殊访问权限或其他特殊条件即可成功利用该漏洞。

风险描述：
1. 攻击者无需以用户身份进行身份验证。
2. 不需要访问受害者计算机上的任何设置或文件。
3. 受害者设备用户不需要进行任何交互操作，无需点击链接、加载图像或执行文件。

影响组件：Windows WiFi 驱动程序

处置建议：强烈建议用户立即更新系统至最新版本。微软已发布相关补丁以修复此漏洞。

补充：由于此漏洞的性质，在设备密集的环境中风险尤为显著，例如酒店、贸易展览会等场所，在这些地方，攻击者可在不引起警觉的情况下对大量用户发动攻击。

相关资料：微软 (https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-30078)/NIST (https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-30078)

##

CVE-2024-28995
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 11.27%

updated 2024-06-11T17:47:22.867000

18 posts

SolarWinds Serv-U was susceptible to a directory transversal vulnerability that would allow access to read sensitive files on the host machine.

Nuclei template

6 repos

https://github.com/krypton-kry/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/ggfzx/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/huseyinstif/CVE-2024-28995-Nuclei-Template

https://github.com/karkis3c/cves

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/0xkucing/CVE-2024-28995

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-14T11:05:02.000Z ##

SolarWinds Serv-U Vulnerability Let Attackers Access sensitive files https://gbhackers.com/solarwinds-serv-u-vulnerability-access-sensitive-files/ #VulnerabilityRemediation #directorytraversal #CVE/vulnerability #CyberSecurityNews #IncidentResponse #NetworkSecurity #SolarWindsServU #CVE202428995

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-15T16:00:15.082Z ##

The Hacker Wire: Testing and Exploiting SolarWinds Serv-U (CVE-2024-28995) Vulnerability
Check out parent toots above for more security advisory and other contextual information about CVE-2024-28995

Exploiting CVE-2024-28995 flaw dose not require any authentication, complex payloads or interactions – just prior knowledge of the target file's path. An attacker can use something as simple as a web browser or curl to make the malicious HTTP request and disclose files.
The only limiting factor is whether the Serv-U service account has read access to the desired file path. By brute-forcing common file paths, an attacker could potentially map out a significant portion of the target's data.

A Proof of Concept bulk scanning utility was written in Python, and "allows checking multiple IPs or file paths in more efficient way."

cc: @reverseics @cR0w

#CVE_2024_28995 #CVE #vulnerability #solarwinds #proofofconcept #poc

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T14:36:54.081Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-28995: Trivially Exploitable Information Disclosure Vulnerability in SolarWinds Serv-U
See parent toot above for more information on CVE-2024-28995. Rapid7's vulnerability research team has reproduced the vulnerability and confirmed that it's trivially exploitable and allows an external unauthenticated attacker to read any file on disk, including binary files, so long as they know the path and the file is not locked (i.e., opened exclusively by something else). Rapid7 expects CVE-2024-28995 to be exploited in the wild soon.

cc: @reverseics @cR0w

#CVE_2024_28995 #CVE #vulnerability #solarwinds

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T16:24:23.158Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory: SolarWinds Serv-U Directory Transversal Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28995)
CVE-2024-28995 (8.6 high) SolarWinds Serv-U was susceptible to a directory transversal vulnerability (cc: @reverseics) that would allow access to read sensitive files on the host machine.

#CVE_2024_28995 #SolarWinds #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-21754
(1.8 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:27

8 posts

A use of password hash with insufficient computational effort vulnerability [CWE-916] affecting FortiOS version 7.4.3 and below, 7.2 all versions, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions and FortiProxy version 7.4.2 and below, 7.2 all versions, 7.0 all versions, 2.0 all versions may allow a privileged attacker with super-admin profile and CLI access to decrypting the backup file.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.870Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.000Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.000Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-13T17:49:02.000Z ##

German security firm G Data has discovered that Fortinet firewalls use weak password hashes to secure backup files.

https://www.gdatasoftware.com/blog/2024/01/37834-passwords-on-a-silver-platter

Tracked as CVE-2024-21754, the vulnerability can be exploited to decrypt backup files and read a device's login credentials.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-423

"Those backup files are commonly sent back and forth via email, for review and control purposes."

#infosec #cybersecurity #security

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.956Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

#PatchTuesday #vulnerability #Fortinet #CVE

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-13T17:49:02.000Z ##

German security firm G Data has discovered that Fortinet firewalls use weak password hashes to secure backup files.

https://www.gdatasoftware.com/blog/2024/01/37834-passwords-on-a-silver-platter

Tracked as CVE-2024-21754, the vulnerability can be exploited to decrypt backup files and read a device's login credentials.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-423

"Those backup files are commonly sent back and forth via email, for review and control purposes."

##

CVE-2023-46720
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:27

2 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.4.0 through 7.4.1 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.7 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.12 and 6.4.6 through 6.4.15 and 6.2.9 through 6.2.16 and 6.0.13 through 6.0.18 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted CLI commands.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.956Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

##

CVE-2024-23110
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:26

4 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2, 7.2.0 through 7.2.6, 7.0.0 through 7.0.13, 6.4.0 through 6.4.14, 6.2.0 through 6.2.15, 6.0 all versions allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted commands

1 repos

#search_error

jbhall56 at 2024-06-13T12:45:08.711Z ##

The most severe of the issues is CVE-2024-23110 (CVSS score of 7.4), which collectively tracks multiple stack-based buffer overflow security defects in the platform’s command line interpreter. https://www.securityweek.com/fortinet-patches-code-execution-vulnerability-in-fortios/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.956Z ##

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)

CVE-2023-23775
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:26

2 posts

Multiple improper neutralization of special elements used in SQL commands ('SQL Injection') vulnerabilities [CWE-89] in FortiSOAR 7.2.0 and before 7.0.3 may allow an authenticated attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specifically crafted strings parameters.

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:26

2 posts

##

CVE-2024-23282(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T09:32:46

4 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5, watchOS 10.5, iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, iOS 16.7.8 and iPadOS 16.7.8. A maliciously crafted email may be able to initiate FaceTime calls without user authorization.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T12:36:08.238Z ##

One of the disclosed Apple vulnerabilities in macOS Sonoma 14.5 from yesterday 10 June 2024 has the wildest impact:

CVE-2024-23282: A maliciously crafted email may be able to initiate FaceTime calls without user authorization

Reminds me of this Twitter gem (see attached image)

Also the vulnerability submitter said this:

This bug can leak user data on iOS even when Lockdown Mode is enabled! While Lockdown Mode blocks incoming FaceTime calls, it cannot block outgoing FaceTime calls.

This is very easy to exploit and is reliable.

#CVE_2024_23282 #Apple #CVE #vulnerability

pancake at 2024-06-11T10:43:13.529Z ##

##

CVE-2024-29855
(9.0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T06:31:53

6 posts

Hard-coded JWT secret allows authentication bypass in Veeam Recovery Orchestrator

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-06-15T15:53:58.034Z ##

Summoning Team: There Are No Secrets || Exploiting Veeam CVE-2024-29855
@SinSinology of Summoning Team provides a full analysis and exploit for CVE-2024-29855 (9.0 critical, see parent toot above for details/security advisory). Proof of concept

This vulenrability [sic] is due to the fact that JWT secret used to generate authentication tokens was a hardcoded value which means an unauthenticated attacker can generate valid tokens for any user (not just the administrator) and login to the Veeam Recovery Orchestrator.

#Veeam #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_29855 #CVE #proofofconcept #poc

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T13:07:48.770Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Veeam Recovery Orchestrator Vulnerability (CVE-2024-29855)
CVE-2024-29855 (9.0 critical, disclosed 10 June 2024 by Veeam) Hard-coded JWT secret allows authentication bypass in Veeam Recovery Orchestrator

Note: The attacker must know the exact username and role of an account that has an active VRO UI access token to accomplish the hijack.

Affects version 7.0.0.337. Resolved in versions 7.1.0.230 and 7.0.0.379. No mention of exploitation.

#Veeam #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_29855 #CVE

CVE-2024-2961(CVSS UNKNOWN)

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:59

2 posts

The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

##

CVE-2023-50387
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 5.00%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:57

2 posts

Certain DNSSEC aspects of the DNS protocol (in RFC 4035 and related RFCs) allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via one or more DNSSEC responses when there is a zone with many DNSKEY and RRSIG records, aka the "KeyTrap" issue. The protocol specification implies that an algorithm must evaluate all combinations of DNSKEY and RRSIG records.

2 repos

https://github.com/Meirelez/SSR-DNSSEC

https://github.com/knqyf263/CVE-2023-50387

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.609Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.000Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

Issue summary: Checking excessively long DSA keys or parameters may be very slow. Impact summary: Applications that use the functions EVP_PKEY_param_check() or EVP_PKEY_public_check() to check a DSA public key or DSA parameters may experience long delays. Where the key or parameters that are being checked have been obtained from an untrusted source this may lead to a Denial of Service. The funct

harrysintonen at 2024-06-09T12:21:26.289Z ##

@chainq @68000 We also release hotfix updates to our "openssl3.library" as needed. However none of the recent vulnerabilities (including CVE-2024-4741 and CVE-2024-4603) warranted a hotfix release as these issues can only occur if a local application uses the affected functionalities. Any security updates to MorphOS openssl3.library are announced at https://www.morphos-team.net/news and https://morph.zone/news/

CVE-2023-50868(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-10T18:30:52

4 posts

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations

1 repos

https://github.com/Goethe-Universitat-Cybersecurity/NSEC3-Encloser-Attack

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.609Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T17:13:37.255Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 51 vulnerabilities, one is publicly disclosed:
MITRE: CVE-2023-50868 (7.5 high) NSEC3 closest encloser proof can exhaust CPU. CVE-2023-50868 is regarding a vulnerability in DNSSEC validation where an attacker could exploit standard DNSSEC protocols intended for DNS integrity by using excessive resources on a resolver, causing a denial of service for legitimate users. MITRE created this CVE on their behalf.

If you consider a publicly disclosed vulnerability a zero-day, that's the takeaway for Microsoft releases. No mention of exploitation for everything else. Checked against the actual MSRC Security Update Guide: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability

cc: @regnil @cR0w @bschwifty @arinc629 @Cali @wvu @hrbrmstr @avoidthehack @bieberium (make sure to remove all the mentions to avoid ReplyAll madness)

#PatchTuesday #Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2023_50868

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.000Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

CVE-2024-23692
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-06-07T18:30:37

2 posts

Rejetto HTTP File Server, up to and including version 2.3m, is vulnerable to a template injection vulnerability. This vulnerability allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the affected system by sending a specially crafted HTTP request. As of the CVE assignment date, Rejetto HFS 2.3m is no longer supported.

Nuclei template

CVE-2024-5480
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-06T21:30:46

1 posts

A vulnerability in the PyTorch's torch.distributed.rpc framework, specifically in versions prior to 2.2.2, allows for remote code execution (RCE). The framework, which is used in distributed training scenarios, does not properly verify the functions being called during RPC (Remote Procedure Call) operations. This oversight permits attackers to execute arbitrary commands by leveraging built-in Pyth

patchnow24x7 at 2024-06-09T04:54:05.603Z ##

Critical : CVSS 10 : Attn!! Artificial Intelligence(AI) Companies and Researchers using PyTorch.
Mitigate CVE-2024-5480

Update Release
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases

https://huntr.com/bounties/39811836-c5b3-4999-831e-46fee8fcade3

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T14:51:33.917Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-29824 Deep Dive: Ivanti EPM SQL Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Horizon3 provides a deep dive for CVE-2024-29824 (9.6 critical, disclosed 21 May 2024 by Ivanti) SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM. Horizon3 relied on the ZDI advisory to look for the function RecordGoodApp, and walked us through how to trigger the vulnerable function. They explain what an indicator of compromise would appear as. Proof of concept provided for CVE-2024-29824.

The vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-24919, affects software in multiple versions of Check Point's CloudGuard Network, Quantum Maestro, Quantum Scalable Chassis, Quantum Security Gateways, and Quantum Spark appliances. All the affected products are Check Point security gateways with IPsec VPN functionality. https://www.darkreading.com/cyberattacks-data-breaches/attacks-surge-on-check-points-recent-vpn-zero-day-flaw

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T18:40:41.125Z ##

Summoning Team: Bypassing Veeam Authentication CVE-2024-29849
Summoning Team has a full analysis and proof of concept exploit code for CVE-2024-29849 (9.8 critical, disclosed 21 May 2024 by Veeam) authentication bypass in Veeam Backup & Replication.

Why you should worry about CVE-2024-29849:
Veeam Backup & Replication has three exploited vulnerabilities that made it to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Missing Authentication: disclosed 10 March 2023, added 22 August 2023 (5 months)
  • CVE-2022-26501 (9.8 critical) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)
  • CVE-2022-26500 (8.8 high) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)

All three of these were known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

#CVE_2024_29849 #Veeam #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #PoC

##

CVE-2024-3661
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-18T05:03:51

2 posts

By design, the DHCP protocol does not authenticate messages, including for example the classless static route option (121). An attacker with the ability to send DHCP messages can manipulate routes to redirect VPN traffic, allowing the attacker to read, disrupt, or possibly modify network traffic that was expected to be protected by the VPN. Many, if not most VPN systems based on IP routing are sus

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.956Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

#PatchTuesday #vulnerability #Fortinet #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

#PatchTuesday #vulnerability #Fortinet #CVE

CVE-2024-1561
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-10T16:31:56

2 posts

An issue was discovered in gradio-app/gradio, where the `/component_server` endpoint improperly allows the invocation of any method on a `Component` class with attacker-controlled arguments. Specifically, by exploiting the `move_resource_to_block_cache()` method of the `Block` class, an attacker can copy any file on the filesystem to a temporary directory and subsequently retrieve it. This vulnera

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T13:44:26.859Z ##

Horizon3a: Exploiting File Read Vulnerabilities in Gradio to Steal Secrets from Hugging Face Spaces
Horizon3 describes file read vulnerabilities CVE-2023-51449 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-1561 (7.5 high) in Gradio. They provide nuclei templates for testing. both vulnerabilities can be used to read arbitrary files from a server hosting Gradio. They stated their work with Hugging Face to harden the Spaces platform after the reported potential breach.

#CVE_2023_51449 #CVE_2024_1561 #Gradio #HuggingFace

CVE-2024-27348
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-02T14:50:57

4 posts

RCE-Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server.This issue affects Apache HugeGraph-Server: from 1.0.0 before 1.3.0 in Java8 & Java11 Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.3.0 with Java11 & enable the Auth system, which fixes the issue.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

AAKL at 2024-06-07T15:30:08.069Z ##

This was fixed with the Apache HugeGraph version 1.3.0 upgrade in April. #cybersecurity #infosec #opensource

POC exploit code published for 9.8-rated Apache HugeGraph RCE flaw CVE-2024-27348 https://www.theregister.com/2024/06/07/poc_apache_hugegraph/ @theregister

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T15:30:08.000Z ##

This was fixed with the Apache HugeGraph version 1.3.0 upgrade in April. #cybersecurity #infosec #opensource

POC exploit code published for 9.8-rated Apache HugeGraph RCE flaw CVE-2024-27348 https://www.theregister.com/2024/06/07/poc_apache_hugegraph/ @theregister

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T02:13:53.000Z ##

SecureLayer7: Analysis of CVE-2024-27348 Apache HugeGraph
Note: SecureLayer7 miswrote the CVE ID in their own title. For all the attention to detail in their analysis, you would think they'd notice a CVE ID missing a number.
CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical, disclosed 22 April 2024 by Apache) Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server. An attacker can bypass the sandbox restrictions and achieve RCE through Gremlin, resulting in complete control over the server. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to understand the root cause (inadequate or missing reflections filtering in the SecurityManager). "This allowed us to access and manipulate various methods, ultimately enabling us to change the task/thread name to bypass all security checks. It was patched by filtering critical system classes and adding new security checks in HugeSecurityManager." Proof of Concept provided.

See related The Register article: POC exploit code published for 9.8-rated Apache HugeGraph RCE flaw

#CVE_2024_27348 #Apache #Hugegraph #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #Poc

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-06T16:59:29.000Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨Apache HugeGraph Server RCE Scanner (CVE-2024-27348).

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #CVE202427348 #Vulnerability

https://github.com/Zeyad-Azima/CVE-2024-27348

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1798761369623515326

CVE-2023-45288
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-01T18:15:10.493000

1 posts

An attacker may cause an HTTP/2 endpoint to read arbitrary amounts of header data by sending an excessive number of CONTINUATION frames. Maintaining HPACK state requires parsing and processing all HEADERS and CONTINUATION frames on a connection. When a request's headers exceed MaxHeaderBytes, no memory is allocated to store the excess headers, but they are still parsed. This permits an attacker to

1 repos

https://github.com/hex0punk/cont-flood-poc

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T22:45:43.000Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-15): CVE-2024-37279 (4.3 medium) Kibana Broken Access Control issue (note: DoS?)
  • Elastic Cloud Enterprise 3.7.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-08) CVE-2023-45288 (aka HTTP/2 Continuation Flood, 5.4 medium, disclosed 03 April 2024) Uncontrolled Resource Consumption through HTTP/2 endpoints
  • Elasticsearch 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-13): CVE-2024-23445 (5.0 medium) Elasticsearch Remote Cluster Search Cross Cluster API Key insufficient restrictions

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-26169
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-04-11T21:30:49

20 posts

Windows Error Reporting Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T14:53:48.367Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog (link might not work)
Hot off the press! CISA adds three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32896 Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical) Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr (I still beat the RSS feed)

#KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiiesCatalog #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_26169 #CVE_2024_4358 #CVE_2024_32896 #CISA #zeroday

##
threatcodex at 2024-06-12T13:23:31.057Z ##

Ransomware Attackers May Have Used Privilege Escalation Vulnerability as Zero-day
#CVE_2024_26169 #BlackBastaGroup
https://symantec-enterprise-blogs.security.com/threat-intelligence/black-basta-ransomware-zero-day

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T11:52:50.390Z ##

Symantec: Ransomware Attackers May Have Used Privilege Escalation Vulnerability as Zero-day
Symantec assesses that the financially motivated Cardinal group (aka Storm-1811, UNC4393) may have CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 March 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Error Reporting Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability as a zero day before it was publicly known and patched. Symantec notes that this group deploys Black Basta ransomware.

The variant of the tool used in this attack ... had a compilation time stamp of February 27, 2024, several weeks before the vulnerability was patched.
A second variant of the tool discovered on Virus Total ... had an earlier compilation time stamp of December 18, 2023.

Symantec provides IOC.

#CVE_2024_26169 #eitw #CVE #activeexploitation #vulnerability #zeroday #threatintel #IOC #ransomware #BlackBasta #Cardinal #Storm1811 #UNC4393

  • CVE-2024-32896 Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical) Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr (I still beat the RSS feed)

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T12:12:12.000Z ##

The security flaw in question is CVE-2024-26169 (CVSS score: 7.8), an elevation of privilege bug in the Windows Error Reporting Service that could be exploited to achieve SYSTEM privileges. ##

CVE-2019-6693
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-04-11T21:02:46

4 posts

Use of a hard-coded cryptographic key to cipher sensitive data in FortiOS configuration backup file may allow an attacker with access to the backup file to decipher the sensitive data, via knowledge of the hard-coded key. The aforementioned sensitive data includes users' passwords (except the administrator's password), private keys' passphrases and High Availability password (when set).

3 repos

https://github.com/gquere/CVE-2019-6693

https://github.com/saladandonionrings/cve-2019-6693

https://github.com/synacktiv/CVE-2020-9289

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.870Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.000Z ##

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

Now their account is gone: https://github.com/varwara/

##

CVE-2024-20693
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T18:30:25

6 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-06-15T15:36:11.095Z ##

Sector7: CVE-2024-20693: Windows cached code signature manipulation
I understand that vendors don't want to share information about vulnerabilities to the point where threat actors understand new attack vectors or variations of severe flaws. But when CVE-2024-20693 (7.8 high, disclosed 09 April 2024) is labeled "Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability," it looks like all of the other vulnerabilities with generalized titles and no description.
Sector7 reported CVE-2024-20693, which allows for manipulating the cached signature signing level of an executable or DLL. They describe how they discovered this issue and its impact. To be honest, there's no way to paraphrase this article or provide a concise summary. I would end up leaving an important detail out. They started with the presentation from @maddiestone and @tiraniddo The Print Spooler Bug that Wasn’t in the Print Spooler at OffensiveCon 2023 to undstand privilege escalation using an impersonated device map and isolation-aware DLLs. The mitigation from Microsoft was not thorough enough, and a lot of privileged services were left with the same issue. They found wscsvc.dll and got sidetracked into finding a signature bypass of Windows DLL files. I'm trying to understand their thought process at a glance, but they've written it as a walkthrough to elevate privileges, bypass WDAC and inject code into protected processes. They plan out a scenario where a user opens a downloaded file (leveraging an unrelated Mark-of-the-Web bypass vulnerability) to full system compromise. Video demonstrates proof of concept.
Sector7 notes that Microsoft didn't fix the problem directly but fixed the instances that were exploited. The timeline also shows Microsoft Security Response Center taking 8 months to resolve a confirmed vulnerability that they successfully reproduced, and that the Microsoft Bounty Team disagreeing 1 month afterward on awarding a bounty.

#CVE_2024_20693 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #eop

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-15T15:36:11.000Z ##

Sector7: CVE-2024-20693: Windows cached code signature manipulation
I understand that vendors don't want to share information about vulnerabilities to the point where threat actors understand new attack vectors or variations of severe flaws. But when CVE-2024-20693 (7.8 high, disclosed 09 April 2024) is labeled "Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability," it looks like all of the other vulnerabilities with generalized titles and no description.
Sector7 reported CVE-2024-20693, which allows for manipulating the cached signature signing level of an executable or DLL. They describe how they discovered this issue and its impact. To be honest, there's no way to paraphrase this article or provide a concise summary. I would end up leaving an important detail out. They started with the presentation from @maddiestone and @tiraniddo The Print Spooler Bug that Wasn’t in the Print Spooler at OffensiveCon 2023 to undstand privilege escalation using an impersonated device map and isolation-aware DLLs. The mitigation from Microsoft was not thorough enough, and a lot of privileged services were left with the same issue. They found wscsvc.dll and got sidetracked into finding a signature bypass of Windows DLL files. I'm trying to understand their thought process at a glance, but they've written it as a walkthrough to elevate privileges, bypass WDAC and inject code into protected processes. We've published our writeup of CVE-2024-20693, a vulnerability in Windows that allowed spoofing the code signature of binaries by placing them on an SMB share. This research originally was about something different, but we ran into a signature check...

##

CVE-2023-4211
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 21.26%

updated 2024-04-04T07:59:36

2 posts

A local non-privileged user can make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.603Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.000Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

##

CVE-2023-38039
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.93%

updated 2024-04-01T15:45:33.510000

2 posts

When curl retrieves an HTTP response, it stores the incoming headers so that they can be accessed later via the libcurl headers API. However, curl did not have a limit in how many or how large headers it would accept in a response, allowing a malicious server to stream an endless series of headers and eventually cause curl to run out of heap memory.

1 repos

https://github.com/Smartkeyss/CVE-2023-38039

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-06-15T20:53:43.000Z ##

another insisted that you can make curl run out of memory by feeding it a long sequence of large HTTP headers. The exact problem we already fixed as a CVE last year (CVE-2023-38039). None of us could reproduce in a current version. Probably caused by a broken build by the reporter or something.

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-06-15T20:53:43.000Z ##

another insisted that you can make curl run out of memory by feeding it a long sequence of large HTTP headers. The exact problem we already fixed as a CVE last year (CVE-2023-38039). None of us could reproduce in a current version. Probably caused by a broken build by the reporter or something.

##

CVE-2024-2887
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-29T04:15:09.423000

2 posts

Type Confusion in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 123.0.6312.86 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T11:21:17.170Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update (ESA-2024-11) CVE-2024-23443 (4.9 medium) Kibana uncontrolled resource consumption (ESA-2024-11) A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 5 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.
  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update CVE-2024-23442 (6.1 medium) Kibana open redirect issue (ESA-2024-10). An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.
  • Kibana 7.17.22 / 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-17) CVE-2024-2887 (9.9 critical) Kibana RCE due to chromium type confusion (ESA-2024-17) On March 26, 2024, a type confusion vulnerability was found in WebAssembly in Google Chrome version prior to 123.0.6312.86 which allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

No mention of exploitation.

#Elastic #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23443 #CVE_2024_23442 #Kibana #CVE_2024_2887

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-14T11:21:17.000Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update (ESA-2024-11) CVE-2024-23443 (4.9 medium) Kibana uncontrolled resource consumption (ESA-2024-11) A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 5 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.
  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update CVE-2024-23442 (6.1 medium) Kibana open redirect issue (ESA-2024-10). An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.
  • Kibana 7.17.22 / 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-17) CVE-2024-2887 (9.9 critical) Kibana RCE due to chromium type confusion (ESA-2024-17) On March 26, 2024, a type confusion vulnerability was found in WebAssembly in Google Chrome version prior to 123.0.6312.86 which allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

No mention of exploitation.

#Elastic #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23443 #CVE_2024_23442 #Kibana #CVE_2024_2887

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T13:44:26.859Z ##

Horizon3a: Exploiting File Read Vulnerabilities in Gradio to Steal Secrets from Hugging Face Spaces
Horizon3 describes file read vulnerabilities CVE-2023-51449 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-1561 (7.5 high) in Gradio. They provide nuclei templates for testing. both vulnerabilities can be used to read arbitrary files from a server hosting Gradio. They stated their work with Hugging Face to harden the Spaces platform after the reported potential breach.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T14:32:59.347Z ##

Imperva: Update: CVE-2024-4577 quickly weaponized to distribute "TellYouThePass" Ransomware
From as early as June 8th, Imperva detected attacker activity leveraging this CVE-2024-4577 to deliver malware, which we have now identified to be a part of the "TellYouThePass" ransomware campaign. (See parent toots above for more information on CVE-2024-4577). TellYouThePass is a ransomware that has been seen since 2019, targeting businesses and individuals, in a campaign for both Windows and Linux systems. It commonly leverages CVE-2021-44228 (Apache Log4j), and has also been seen using CVE-2023-46604, among others. Imperva described the attack vector, and has a technical analysis of the sample. IOC provided.

h/t: @BleepingComputer reporting: TellYouThePass ransomware exploits recent PHP RCE flaw to breach servers

##

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 4.38%

updated 2024-01-31T05:07:15

2 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

1 repos

#search_error

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-18T10:02:44.955Z ##

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

Tags

#VMware #vCenterServer #CVE-2023-34048 #RemoteCodeExecution #PatchManagement #Cybersecurity

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-18T10:02:44.000Z ##

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T18:33:47.765Z ##

@dreadpir8robots good catch, I guess 50868 doesn't have a designer name (but is related)

cc: @shellsharks CVE-2023-50867 is actually #KeyTrap stead of 50868

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.609Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T18:33:47.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots good catch, I guess 50868 doesn't have a designer name (but is related)

cc: @shellsharks CVE-2023-50867 is actually #KeyTrap stead of 50868

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.000Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

CVE-2023-46604
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.14%

updated 2023-11-28T22:24:39

2 posts

Apache ActiveMQ is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution.The vulnerability may allow a remote attacker with network access to a broker to run arbitrary shell commands by manipulating serialized class types in the OpenWire protocol to cause the broker to instantiate any class on the classpath.  Users are recommended to upgrade to version 5.15.16, 5.16.7, 5.17.6, or 5.18.3, which fixes this issue.

CVE-2022-41352
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.46%

updated 2023-10-18T05:03:30

4 posts

An issue was discovered in Zimbra Collaboration (ZCS) 8.8.15 and 9.0. An attacker can upload arbitrary files through amavisd via a cpio loophole (extraction to /opt/zimbra/jetty/webapps/zimbra/public) that can lead to incorrect access to any other user accounts. Zimbra recommends pax over cpio. Also, pax is in the prerequisites of Zimbra on Ubuntu; however, pax is no longer part of a default Red H

https://github.com/segfault-it/cve-2022-41352

https://github.com/Cr4ckC4t/cve-2022-41352-zimbra-rce

https://github.com/qailanet/cve-2022-41352-zimbra-rce

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T13:17:40.634Z ##

Mandiant and Google TAG: Insights on Cyber Threats Targeting Users and Enterprises in Brazil
Brazil is apparently a hotbed of cybercriminal and espionage activity due to its economy and influence in South America. Mandiant and Google Threat Analysis Group (TAG) talk about how China, Russia and North Korean state-sponsored actors target Brazil:

North Korean government-backed groups, for example, have shown a keen interest in Brazilian cryptocurrency firms, aerospace and defense, and government targets. PRC groups, meanwhile, have targeted Brazilian government organizations, as well as the energy sector. Russian cyber espionage groups have targeted users in Brazil regularly dating back more than a decade; however since the start of Russia’s war in Ukraine, Russian activity targeting Brazil has scaled back considerably

Mandiant and TAG also talk about Brazil's "unique cybercrime ecosystem": ransomware and data theft extortion as well as underground forum and social media advertisements for access to malicious insiders, databases, sensitive information, and specialized tools to compromise Brazilian users and institutions.

For the amount of information in this blog, the IOC is relatively light.

#Brazil #cybercrime #cyberespionage #threatintel #infostealer #UNC4841 #CVE_2022_41352 #UNC4899 #APT28 #GoPix #UNC5176 #URSA #Astaroth

##

##

CVE-2022-24834
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.34%

updated 2023-08-14T19:15:09.603000

4 posts

Redis is an in-memory database that persists on disk. A specially crafted Lua script executing in Redis can trigger a heap overflow in the cjson library, and result with heap corruption and potentially remote code execution. The problem exists in all versions of Redis with Lua scripting support, starting from 2.6, and affects only authenticated and authorized users. The problem is fixed in version

1 repos

https://github.com/convisolabs/CVE-2022-24834

raptor at 2024-06-15T20:10:58.650Z ##

CVE-2022-38181
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 37.86%

updated 2023-06-21T05:01:11

2 posts

An Arm product family through 2022-08-12 mail GPU kernel driver allows non-privileged users to make improper GPU processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.

2 repos

https://github.com/Pro-me3us/CVE_2022_38181_Raven

https://github.com/Pro-me3us/CVE_2022_38181_Gazelle

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.603Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T18:40:41.125Z ##

Summoning Team: Bypassing Veeam Authentication CVE-2024-29849
Summoning Team has a full analysis and proof of concept exploit code for CVE-2024-29849 (9.8 critical, disclosed 21 May 2024 by Veeam) authentication bypass in Veeam Backup & Replication.

Why you should worry about CVE-2024-29849:
Veeam Backup & Replication has three exploited vulnerabilities that made it to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Missing Authentication: disclosed 10 March 2023, added 22 August 2023 (5 months)
  • CVE-2022-26501 (9.8 critical) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)
  • CVE-2022-26500 (8.8 high) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)

All three of these were known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

#CVE_2024_29849 #Veeam #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #PoC

The Arm Mali GPU kernel driver allows privilege escalation or information disclosure because GPU memory operations are mishandled, leading to a use-after-free. This affects Bifrost r0p0 through r28p0 before r29p0, Valhall r19p0 through r28p0 before r29p0, and Midgard r4p0 through r30p0.

##

CVE-2019-2054
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-02-28T20:47:18.963000

1 posts

In the seccomp implementation prior to kernel version 4.8, there is a possible seccomp bypass due to seccomp policies that allow the use of ptrace. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android Versions: Android kernel Android ID: A-119769499

jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-06-06T13:53:19.000Z ##

@jpetazzo Hmm. 'ptrace' is included twice; once gated by kernel version >=4.8 (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L419), which addresses CVE-2019-2054, and one gated by CAP_SYS_PTRACE (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L739). So that seems ok for the default config, although I've seen people copy ungated 'ptrace' into the list of allowed calls, which at least opens up CVE-2019-2054 for vulnerable kernels.

But 'prctl' should allow you to change the filter itself, and 'seccomp' could be used to disable seccomp, I think?

screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T15:34:29.525Z ##

Fortinet: New Agent Tesla Campaign Targeting Spanish-Speaking People
A new phishing campaign spreads a new Agent Tesla variant targeting Spanish-speaking people. The campaign leverages multiple techniques to deliver the Agent Tesla core module. The following vulnerabilities are exploited and mentioned in this blog:

  • CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 April 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office/WordPad Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Fortinet describes the infection chain, provides technical analyses into the malware, and lists what sensitive information is stolen from victims and exfiltrated to an FTP server. IOC provided.

#agenttesla #malware #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_11882 #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T15:34:29.000Z ##

Fortinet: New Agent Tesla Campaign Targeting Spanish-Speaking People
A new phishing campaign spreads a new Agent Tesla variant targeting Spanish-speaking people. The campaign leverages multiple techniques to deliver the Agent Tesla core module. The following vulnerabilities are exploited and mentioned in this blog:

  • CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 April 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office/WordPad Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Fortinet describes the infection chain, provides technical analyses into the malware, and lists what sensitive information is stolen from victims and exfiltrated to an FTP server. IOC provided.

#agenttesla #malware #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_11882 #eitw

##

CVE-2017-11882
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.44%

updated 2023-02-01T05:03:36

6 posts

Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3, Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2, Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1, and Microsoft Office 2016 allow an attacker to run arbitrary code in the context of the current user by failing to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11884.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T11:47:16.938Z ##

ASEC: Keylogger Installed Using MS Office Equation Editor Vulnerability (Kimsuky)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) reports that the North Korean state actor Kimsuky exploited CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability to distribute a keylogger. Kimsuky leveraged the vulnerability to run a page with an embedded malicious script with the mshta process. IOC provided.

#Kimsuky #NorthKorea #cyberespionage #CVE_2017_11882 #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T13:04:25.374Z ##

Cofense: STR RAT – Phishing Malware Baseline
Cofense provides a rather high level overview of STR, a remote access trojan that is written in Java, and first observed in 2020. It receives near-annual updates which is noted by the uptick in its use by others. Cofense talks about its history, infection method, capabilities, and loaders. One of the loaders mentioned leverages CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Cofense does not provide hashes but their IOC consist of C2 addresses (and network/registry run key indicators).

#threatintel #STRrat #malwareanalysis #IOC #CVE_2017_11882

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T15:34:29.525Z ##

Fortinet: New Agent Tesla Campaign Targeting Spanish-Speaking People
A new phishing campaign spreads a new Agent Tesla variant targeting Spanish-speaking people. The campaign leverages multiple techniques to deliver the Agent Tesla core module. The following vulnerabilities are exploited and mentioned in this blog:

  • CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 April 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office/WordPad Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Fortinet describes the infection chain, provides technical analyses into the malware, and lists what sensitive information is stolen from victims and exfiltrated to an FTP server. IOC provided.

#agenttesla #malware #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_11882 #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T11:47:16.000Z ##

ASEC: Keylogger Installed Using MS Office Equation Editor Vulnerability (Kimsuky)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) reports that the North Korean state actor Kimsuky exploited CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability to distribute a keylogger. Kimsuky leveraged the vulnerability to run a page with an embedded malicious script with the mshta process. IOC provided.

#Kimsuky #NorthKorea #cyberespionage #CVE_2017_11882 #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T13:04:25.000Z ##

Cofense: STR RAT – Phishing Malware Baseline
Cofense provides a rather high level overview of STR, a remote access trojan that is written in Java, and first observed in 2020. It receives near-annual updates which is noted by the uptick in its use by others. Cofense talks about its history, infection method, capabilities, and loaders. One of the loaders mentioned leverages CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Cofense does not provide hashes but their IOC consist of C2 addresses (and network/registry run key indicators).

#threatintel #STRrat #malwareanalysis #IOC #CVE_2017_11882

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T15:34:29.000Z ##
